game satisfactorily, we need not be
troubled by this objection.
It might be urged that when playing the “imitation game” the best strat-
egy for the machine may possibly be something other than imitation of the
behavior of a man. This may be, but I think it is unlikely that there is any
great effect of this kind. In any case there is no intention to investigate here
the theory of the game, and it will be assumed that the best strategy is to try
to provide answers that would naturally be given by
